poem:
### Whirlwind of Lies

Beneath the silent sky,  
the waters rise unseen,  
as man weaves storms  
from threads of deceit.  
In the eye, a voice—  
not nature's, but ours,  
churns the air with  
a reckless sigh,  
our own tempests,  
where truth loses shape,  
lost among the shifting clouds.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump and his allies are whipping up a whirlwind of lies about the hurricanes | Sidney Blumenthal Whipping up hurricanes to merge with great replacement theory took hardly a week, about the time it takes for hurricanes themselves to form. The overheated atmosphere warmed the waters that were drawn up into the winds to churn them into a menacing storm. After Hurricane Helene hit, Donald Trump unleashed a whirlwind of humid lies: the federal government". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
